column4: does anyone know how to resume your laptop after you close it in terminal?
i installed the command line version
does anyone know how to resume your laptops screen after you close it while its in console mode
laptop-specific question, works for some, it doesn't for others
wat you mean?
what do you mean laptop specific? i have a dell inspiron 1300

it really depends on your computer, hibernating and suspending doesn't work on all laptops, so you are better searching the forums for your specific model, maybe someone has already written a guide for it.
so i can
i cant close my laptop while its in console? cause hibernating etc worked on windows
also the laptop is on .. i can hear the sound etc, its just the screen is off
I tell you, it is laptop-specif, it depends on drivers, it is tricky. Unless the manufacturers cooperate, these stuff may never totally work reversed-engineered on Linux
i have 1 more question. do you know how to connect a wireless card via terminal
like ifconfig eth1 essid="lol" etc//
most information to configure the card can be found in the manual "man iwconfig"  then read "man ifconfig"
alright ill take a look , because i got the card working on linux with ndiswrapper but i want to test the driver that comes with the distro
also i just remembered that when you close the laptop screen and you open it , it will resume but in locked mode. atm this is a fresh install so it has no gui
which wireless card? Probably intel, broadcom or ralink.
yea its broadcom 4318 i think
i know it works cause i used it before on ubuntu
yeah, it should work with ndiswrapper but probably you can only get 11 Mbps with the included bcm43xx
so i dont need help setting up the card. but i want to know how to connect a wireless card via terminal.. before i used the network-admin
yea cause this wireless card sux. it's only goes up to 11
you are confusing me... do you, or do you not how to connect through the terminal with "iwconfig" and "ifconfig"
